pages.text: These ranchus may look bland at first, but they come in over 100 different color variations, as well as 3 different tail variations, totaling up for over 300 total variations! When you first find some ranchus, they will be a beige color. However, through breeding them you can discover some beautiful colors. Reds, blacks, oranges, whites, the list goes on.
An orange and white ranchu, with black stripes and a short tail.
A black ranchu, with white accents and a medium tail.
A red and white ranchu, with black stripes and a long tail.
